defaultPosition.description:
â¢ Adjudicate complex and highly sensitive immigration benefits, including affirmative asylum and asylum pre-screening, while determining admissibility and credibility.
â¢ Notify appropriate officers and offices at appropriate levels regarding possible indicators of fraud, criminal activity, or threats to national security.
â¢ Review information from law enforcement databases and other records to identify individuals who are ineligible for asylum due to national security, public safety, or other grounds.
â¢ Travel to immigration processing centers, as required, to conduct on-site interviews and decision services while partnering on-site staff. 
â¢ Interpret and apply appropriate policies, regulations, statutes, and precedential decisions to make eligibility determinations. 
â¢ Produce written assessments supporting affirmative asylum and asylum pre-screening decisions.  
â¢ Communicate in a clear, concise, and tactful manner through a variety of media to contact attorneys, as required, to request necessary documents, evidence, or client appearance. 
â¢ Review applications, supporting evidence, and research appropriate information provided by the Refugee, Asylum and International Operations Directorate, the Department of State, and other public and private sources.
defaultPosition.title: Asylum Officer

positions.description:
â¢Selected as one of 110 recipients (top 21%) for government funding through a competitive selection process in which 526 graduate students across the United States applied
â¢Planned a comprehensive overseas research and intensive language study program requiring overseas affiliation and development of a comprehensive budget.
â¢Lived with a host family in Turkey studying Turkish and researching the implications of Kurdish nationalism on US national security and Middle East stability.
â¢Met reporting and testing deadlines required by program headquarters in Washington, D.C. 
â¢Adhered to strict moral, professional, and appearance standards required as a recipient of government funding and a representative of the United States abroad
positions.title: Fellow

â¢Lived with a host family in Turkey and attended intensive Turkish language instruction
â¢Met reporting and testing deadlines required by program headquarters in Washington, D.C. 
â¢Adhered to strict moral, professional, and appearance standards required as a recipient of government funding and a representative of the United States abroad
positions.title: Scholarship Recipient

positions.description:
â¢Served as Second in Command, supervising all Company activities and personnel, for a Company of 295-Soldiers deployed in support of Operation Enduring Freedom.
â¢Planned and managed operations for a Europe-based Battalion of 750-Soldiers. 
â¢Selected by the Battalion Commander to lead an 8-man team to Poland to mentor a Polish military battalion to improve relations and communication between NATO allies. 
â¢Selected by the Battalion Commander to lead an 11-man security augmentation force to partner with local law enforcement to provide emergency security for an isolated military installation.  
â¢Coordinated with US Embassy and foreign military staff to provide security while visiting foreign nations.
â¢Supervised equipment and personnel redistribution throughout the Company, Battalion, and Brigade following an eleven-month combat deployment, earning an Army Commendation Medal. 
â¢Acted as human resources manager to provide human resources support for an 843-soldier Battalion while deployed in a combat zone, earning an Army Achievement Medal. 
â¢Conducted investigations involving soldier misconduct and financial liability and instructed subordinate officers in the conduct of military investigations.
â¢Selected by the Battalion Commander to coordinate with attorneys to streamline processing of legal paperwork. 
â¢Managed the maintenance, readiness, and accountability of all company property worth in excess of $100 million. 
â¢Supervised the packing and transportation of over $50 million worth of property from Afghanistan to Germany. 
â¢Worked with three NATO countries and five US Army aviation brigades to manage all aerial movement in Southern Afghanistan
positions.title: 11A-Infantry Officer
